conbody.p: If you cannot launch or connect to an instance, before you troubleshoot further you should first make sure that the problem is an actual error condition as opposed to a lack of available resources. Check the cloud state to ensure you have enough CPU, memory, disk, and public IP addresses available for the instance to rule out a resource-related issue. The command euca-describe-availability-zone verbose and euca-describe-addresses verbose are useful to verify resource availability.
